diff_analysis.evidence: In the OLD code, several state-changing endpoints were exposed as POST without any CSRF protection, while the NEW code changes them to GET. Examples include /reset/db, /reset/uploads, /reset in backend/apps/rag/main.py and /reset and /delete/user in backend/apps/webui/routers/memories.py. These POST endpoints rely solely on bearer authentication and are callable from a browser context, making them susceptible to Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) in the OLD version.
